Detailed Description

IpAddr specifies a IPV4 IP address. IP address must be passed in big endian format to socket functions. IpAddr will care for that conversion.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef UINT32 IpAddr::Persist
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum IpAddr::PredefIpAddr
 

PredefIpAddr specifies well defined IPV4 addresses.
c_ipaddr_loopback 127.0.0.1
c_ipaddr_any 0.0.0.0
c_ipaddr_broadcast 255.255.255.255

Enumerator:
c_ipaddr_loopback 
c_ipaddr_any 
c_ipaddr_broadcast 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

IpAddr::IpAddr (  UINT32  addr = 0,
BOOLEAN  convert_from_native = FALSE
) 
 

Use this ctor to construct an IP address from UINT32 type. If the given address is in big endian format pass FALSE to parameter two. Otherwise specify TRUE for triggering the conversion from native byte ordering to big endian (null operation if target is big endian).

IpAddr::IpAddr (  UINT8  a,
UINT8  b,
UINT8  c,
UINT8  d
) 
 

Use this ctor to construct an IP address from the given atomic parts of an IP address.

IpAddr::IpAddr (  const CHAR *  str,
INT  len = -1
) 
 

Use this ctor to construct an IP address a character string.

Parameters:
character string in form of a.b.c.d.
len specifies the length of given string. If len < 0 a null terminated string is expected.

IpAddr::IpAddr (  PredefIpAddr  pre  ) 
 

Use this ctor to construct a standard IP address

IpAddr::IpAddr (  const WCHAR *  str,
INT  len = -1
) 
 

Use this ctor to construct an IP address a wide character string.

Parameters:
character string in form of a.b.c.d.
len specifies the length of given string. If len < 0 a null terminated string is expected.

BOOLEAN IpAddr::InitFrom (  const WCHAR *  str,
INT  len = -1
) 
 

Use InitFrom to initialize IP address from a wide character string. String format must not divert from a.b.c.d form. Returns FALSE malformed string is specified.

Parameters:
character string in form of a.b.c.d.
len specifies the length of given string. If len < 0 a null terminated string is expected.

BOOLEAN IpAddr::InitFrom (  const CHAR *  str,
INT  len = -1
) 
 

Use InitFrom to initialize IP address from a single byte character string. String format must not divert from a.b.c.d form. Returns FALSE malformed string is specified.

Parameters:
character string in form of a.b.c.d.
len specifies the length of given string. If len < 0 a null terminated string is expected.

Use this operator to persist IP address

void IpAddr::SetAddr (  UINT32  addr,
BOOLEAN  convert_from_native = FALSE
) 
 

Set IP address. Parameter two specifies if the given address is in big endian format. If not, SetAddr will convert the given parameter from native to big endian byte ordering
